      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from interface: MotorGroup
        This should return the name of the MotorGroup. This should only be used for human identification purposes, not in code. If no name has been set (for instance through a constructor) it should return the name of its class file.
        Specified by:
        getName in interface MotorGroup
        Returns:
        A String representing the name of the MotorGroup.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(float motorsOut)
        Description copied from interface: MotorGroup
        Sets the value of output for the motors. -1 should represent full speed backwards, 0 should represent completely stopped, 1 should represent full speed forward. Any non linearity or other control systems (voltage based, PID, PWM, etc...) are up to the implementation, as long as they follow those guidelines. TODO: Rename this method! Perhaps setOutput() ?
        Specified by:
        setValue in interface MotorGroup
        Parameters:
        motorsOut - A float between -1 an 1.

      • getSetValue

        public float getSetValue()
        Description copied from interface: MotorGroup
        This should return the value corresponding to the last setValue. If the MotorGroup is disabled, it should still return the value that will resume being used when re-enabled.
        Specified by:
        getSetValue in interface MotorGroup
        Returns:
        The float the MotorGroup is set to.

      • getSpeed

        public float getSpeed()
        Description copied from interface: MotorGroup
        Returns the speed in rpm of the motor shafts, undefined if canMeasureSpeed is false or null.
        Specified by:
        getSpeed in interface MotorGroup
        Returns:

      • getGearsAmount

        public int getGearsAmount()
        Description copied from interface: MotorGroup
        Returns the number of gears this MotorGroup has. This should be a number between 1 and infinity as you always have one gear.
        Specified by:
        getGearsAmount in interface MotorGroup
        Returns:
        An int representing the number of gearing positions this motor group can be in.

      • getGear

        public int getGear()
        Description copied from interface: MotorGroup
        Gets the gear of the motor. This should update immediately with new gears from setGear, if shifting fails, etc.. it should update back to it's actual state.
        Specified by:
        getGear in interface MotorGroup
        Returns:
        An int representing the current gear of the motor group.

      • setGear

        public void setGear(int gear)
        Description copied from interface: MotorGroup
        Sets the gear of the MotorGroup. This starts from 0 as the highest torque/ lowest speed, up to getGearsAmount() -1.
        Specified by:
        setGear in interface MotorGroup
        Parameters:
        gear - Sets the gear of this MotorGroup.
